translated: Elder Story🔽The Chapter about Supāriya’s Practice
The Elder Desapūjaka’s Story
“The Fortunate One, the Seer of the Truth,
the Elder of the world, the Bull of Men,
having risen up into the sky,
goes along without faltering.
In whatever place the Teacher stood,
the Great Seer rose up;
I worshipped that place,
with my hands raised in faith.

analyzed: aṭṭhārase kappa sate  addasam yam mahā muni
translated: For eighteen-hundred eons,🔽I saw that Great Seer;
I do not know of a bad destination,
this is the fruit of worshipping a place.
For eleven-hundred eons,
called Gosu,
endowed with the seven treasures,
a powerful Universal Monarch.
The four analytical insights,
I have done what the Awakened One said.”🔽Thus the Elder Desapūjaka recited these verses.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā desapūjako thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Desapūjakattherassāpadānaṁ catutthaṁ.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmā desapūjakaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati 🔽desapūjaka therassa apadānam catuttha
translated: The Elder Desapūjaka’s Story is finished.
